name: Reported measles case rate
descriptionShort: Reported number of measles cases in the United States per 100,000 people.
datasetName: Long-run reported cases of measles in the United States

origins.title: Historical Measles Cases - United States
origins.description:
Data on historical measles cases in the United States, compiled from a selection of government sources.

Sources for each year are as follows:

* 1919: Public Health Reports (1896-1970), Vol. 36, No. 8 - [The Notifiable Diseases: Prevalence during 1919 in States](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4575902?seq=25)

* 1921: Public Health Reports Vol. 37, No. 41 - [The Notifiable Diseases: Prevalence during 1921 in States. Anthrax, Cerebrospinal Meningitis, Dengue, Diphtheria, Gonorrhea, Influenza, Malaria, Measles, Pneumonia, Poliomyelitis, Rabies, Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever, Scarlet Fever, Septic Sore Throat, Smallpox, Syphilis, Tuberculosis (All Forms and Pulmonary), Typhoid Fever, and Typhus Fever](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4576538?seq=1)

* 1924: Public Health Reports Vol. 40, No. 51 - [The Notifiable Diseases: Prevalence during 1924 in States](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4577735?seq=34)

* 1925: Public Health Reports Vol. 42, No. 1 - [The Notifiable Diseases: Prevalence during 1924 in States](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4578131?seq=2)

* 1938-1943: US Census Bureau - [Part 2 - Vital Statistics, Statistical Abstract of the United States 1944-45](https://www.census.gov/library/publications/1945/compendia/statab/66ed.html)

* 1944-1984: [Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report Annual Supplement Summary 1993 Vol. 42, No. 53 by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), US Public Health Service](https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/index93.html)
origins.producer: Public Health Reports; US Census Bureau; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
origins.citationFull:
Public Health Reports (1896-1970), Vol. 36, No. 8. The Notifiable Diseases: Prevalence during 1919 in States.

Public Health Reports Vol. 37, No. 41. The Notifiable Diseases: Prevalence during 1921 in States. Anthrax, Cerebrospinal Meningitis, Dengue, Diphtheria, Gonorrhea, Influenza, Malaria, Measles, Pneumonia, Poliomyelitis, Rabies, Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever, Scarlet Fever, Septic Sore Throat, Smallpox, Syphilis, Tuberculosis (All Forms and Pulmonary), Typhoid Fever, and Typhus Fever.

Public Health Reports Vol. 40, No. 51. The Notifiable Diseases: Prevalence during 1924 in States.

US Census Bureau. Part 2 - Vital Statistics, Statistical Abstract of the United States 1944-45.

Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report Annual Supplement Summary 1993 Vol. 42, No. 53 by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), US Public Health Service.

origins.title: CDC Yearly measles cases (1985-present)
origins.description: Annual measles cases as reported by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).
origins.producer: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
origins.citationFull: Measles Cases and Outbreaks (2025). Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

origins.title: Population
origins.description:
Our World in Data builds and maintains a long-run dataset on population by country, region, and for the world, based on various sources.

You can find more information on these sources and how our time series is constructed on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
origins.citationFull: The long-run data on population is based on various sources, described on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
